intro: Elaeagnus conferta var. mollis, commonly known as silverleaf buckthorn, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by dark red berries in the fall. It is often grown as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and winter interest. Elaeagnus conferta var. mollis is also valued for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its role in erosion control.
